about.summary: This framework allows you to design and implement complex pipelines, and deploy them on your institution's computing cluster. This has been built keeping in mind the needs of bioinformatics workflows. However, it is easily extendable to any field where a series of steps (shell commands) are to be executed in a (work)flow.

name: r-flowr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.9.10' %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-flowr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: flowr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/flowr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/flowr/flowr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: af5dce8b7fa8cae55da91ef07d10b2075e02e815e55bb48c5847a0f11cd4b2a2

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 1001

  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - r-base
    - r-diagram
    - r-params >=0.3
    - r-whisker

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-diagram
    - r-params >=0.3
    - r-whisker

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('flowr')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('flowr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/sahilseth/flowr
  license: MIT
  summary: This framework allows you to design and implement complex pipelines, and deploy them
    on your institution's computing cluster. This has been built keeping in mind the
    needs of bioinformatics workflows. However, it is easily extendable to any field
    where a series of steps (shell commands) are to be executed in a (work)flow.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
